column4: Hi all. I have a FAT32 hardrive and all my data appears to be missing. I can't view it but the drive is not empty. Is there any way for me to repair this?
r00t: in terminal?
what happened to the disk?  Can you mount it by hand?
so df -h   shows it being full? empty? or what?
how do I do that?
Excuse that ignorant question.
do what? 'df -h'  ? open a terminal.. type it in.. see what % used is..
It shows 96% usage which is about right
The drive did have very little availabel space before I had an issue
so if you cd to the mountmoint and do a 'ls -R' it may or may not show the files...
its possible they all got moved to some subdir
What exactly should I be looking for in the 'ls -R'? Seems like a lot...
How can I use 'ls-R' but only print one page at a time? It is removing all the important stuff from the terminal window
so it is showing files then? and not just the directorie names?
'ls -R | less'
you said the disk looked empty.. so ls showing a lot is a good sign i guess. :)
It only shows the _restore data. I'm sure there is a sector issue or something.
All the expected data folders are empty.
so where did _restore come from?

you may want to ask in #windows for advice on scan/repairing a fat filesystem.  theres numerous live cd's that can help fix/recover things. but i tend to just dd the whole drive  a image file and fsck it.. that may not be the 'best' way.
Sorry, my connection dropped. The _restore stuff is in System Volume Information. I think its Windows stuff. Not too sure
Sorry, my connection dropped. The _restore stuff is in System Volume Information. I think its Windows stuff. Not too sure
